entries.meaning: Having the characteristics of a miscellany.
examples: Punjab Notes and Queries  […]  was ethnographic and miscellanist in nature, but its organization was confused.

entries.meaning: An author or editor of one or more miscellanies; one who produces written works having a wide range of forms or kinds of content.
examples: Leigh Hunt tried almost every conceivable kind of literature, including a historical novel.  […]  All this we may not unkindly brush away, and consider him first as a poet, secondly as a critic, and thirdly as what can be best, though rather unphilosophically, called a miscellanist.
